Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
January 2021 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Time seems to be whistling past, and we can't believe it is February already! We are thrilled to say it's been such a great start for the first quarter of the year, and we expect it to be a great period regarding projects, sales, and health for the company. The entire month of February is filled with friendship and love, so do not miss the chance to embrace the spirit with colleagues, friends and family.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

2020 Year in Review: You might have already read our "2020 Year in Review" series of Onward posts. It was a joint effort among multiple teams towards the end of the year.

Portal Content Update: Without fail, we added more content for our visitors. Within this month, we added new 50-State Resources: Alimony Forms & Paternity Forms. We've also updated some of our COVID-19 center pages, such as Travel Restrictions, Information for Employees, Taxes, and more.

Updated Internal Announcements: We have revamped some of our internal email announcements with a new design for work anniversaries, birthdays, and new team member welcome emails.

Holiday Donations: Justia donated to “Feeding America” on behalf of our clients and to “Casa Colibri A.C.” on behalf of the Justia team. “Casa Colibri A. C.” helps vulnerable children and teenagers in Coahuila. “Feeding America” is the largest domestic hunger-relief organization in the United States.

Holiday cards to Justia Clients: As a token of appreciation, Justia sent out holiday cards to its clients to highlight that we are thankful to work with them and cheer them up to cope with these hard times.

Sales Kept Coming In: Despite the pandemic being in full swing almost the whole year, our sales team had weekly and monthly record-breaking sales.

NEW INTERNS | NEW FULL TIME EMPLOYEES

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Jorge Contreras

Help Desk - Intern

Hi! I'm Jorge, and I'm 24 years old. I am about to graduate in Computer Systems Engineering. I'm from Saltillo, Coahuila, and I'm mainly interested in front-end web development. I love new challenges, and I also enjoy

learning new things. I'm a very happy person who enjoys listening to music, playing the ukulele, and drinking coffee. I like working in teams, meeting new people, and sharing ideas with others. I'm very excited to start this new adventure with Justia, and I plan to give my best.

DID YOU KNOW?

Tim Participated in a Free Webinar About Marketing

Yes! On January 28th, Tim Stanley, our CEO, participated in the free webinar "Smart Branding and Promotion of Your Law Firm in the Digital Age – It Should Not Cost You a Fortune, But It Could Make You One"! The webinar was intended for plaintiff and criminal defense attorneys and paralegals. It covered different topics from Grass Root Marketing, GMB, SEO, Reputation Management, to Ethical Promotion of the Practice.

upcoming holidays

Dates to Remember

Mexican Constitution Day
February 5th

Constitution Day is a federal public holiday in Mexico. On this day, people in Mexico commemorate the anniversary of Mexico’s current constitution, which was promulgated back on February 5th, 1917.

Valentine’s Day
February 14th

Valentine's Day is celebrated on February 14. It is a popular festival of romantic love across the United States and other places worldwide. On this day, people express their affection with cards, letters, flowers, or give presents to their loved ones.

CRAZY LAWS

Crazy Love-Related Laws

We've compiled a list of five crazy love-related laws you may not believe exist.

Despite being the city which is home to the famed “Callejón del Beso” (Kissing Alley), a law passed in 2009 prohibited kissing in public in Guanajuato, Mexico.

In Vermont, United States, women needing false teeth must first get written permission from their husbands to do so.

In France, it has been illegal to kiss in train stations and especially on their platforms since 1910.

In North Carolina, United States, if a man and woman who aren’t married go to a hotel and register themselves as married, then according to state law, they are married.

In Wichita, Kansas, the mistreatment of mothers-in-law can be used as grounds for divorce. So you’d better be nice to your mother-in-law if you want to keep your marriage!

COMPANY EVENTS

Ugly Sweater Contest

Justia held its 2020 Ugly Sweater contest on Monday, December 14, at the end of our team meeting. We thank all entrants who had the chance to show off their sweaters. Congratulations to the winners who claimed the bragging rights to the title until next year and the Amazon gift card prizes.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Peace Is Every Breath

Available on Amazon

"Peace Is Every Breath: A Practice for Our Busy Lives is a beautiful book by Zen Buddhist master Thích Nhất Hạnh that guides readers through the power of mindfulness. From moment to moment - even amidst our busy workdays - we can find inner peace, happiness, and joy through being compassionately present. This is an insightful read for everyone from all backgrounds."

- Katherine Le

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta & Jose Ramos
